intro: Cynoglossum subscaposum, commonly known as the slender bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of blue to purple, which bloom from late summer to early autumn. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Cynoglossum subscaposum is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and rocky habitats.
